thread.title: Obama 2008 campaign manager endorses Hillary
thread.title_full: Obama 2008 campaign manager endorses Hillary | Washington Examiner

author: Curt Mills
title: Obama 2008 campaign manager endorses Hillary
text:
David Plouffe, one of the architects of President Obama's historic 2008 White House victory, endorsed Hillary Clinton Saturday, Obama's rival from that campaign.
"To be honest, during the most intense days of the 2008 primary, I would never have imagined writing this piece," Plouffe, writing his endorsement on Medium . "I doubt Team Clinton felt any differently about me."
Related Story: http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/article/2574118/ "She doesn't quit. And there were times I wish she had! But you have to deeply admire that strength and persistence," Plouffe said. "Americans still need a president who will wake up every day, prepared to overcome any obstacle on their behalf.
  Awkward pair: 'Did I get too close' Katy Perry, Bill Clinton Katy Perry's lyrics may have some echoes of the former president's salacious past.
By Sean Langille • 10/24/15 5:37 PM Hillary Clinton should — and I believe will — be that president."
After 2008, Plouffe went on to be a White House official, and currently is a senior vice president at Uber.
Plouffe made no mention of Vice President Joe Biden, or if he had been waiting on his decision before making his endorsement.
Jim Messina headed Obama's 2012 campaign. He has also endorsed Clinton, helping her effort as early as January 2014 .
Also from the Washington Examiner Trump on super PACs: 'I think they’re the dumbest thing' Trump suggested most of the leading outside support groups backing presidential candidates "are a disaster."
  4:50 PM Top Story Trump: I tried to tell Carson about his Iowa lead 'but he was sleeping'   while Trump lagged behind.
  1:10 PM
